name: Peninsula Excelsior Hotel

reviews.title: never again
reviews.text: This Singapore Hotel was abysmal, the rooms were worn out not particularly clean, the bar very expensive S$12.50 for a Guiness. A poster in the lift announced that the hotel had gone through extensive renovations (must have used second hand gear ). THe delays at reception were unacceptable on check in and check out, thank goodness they were not busy. On my second visit a week later the room was no better and the breakfast, well, the fried eggs were off as the chef did not arrive until 7.30 am, all the food in the hot trays was luke warm and must have been prepared the night before and the lights put on underneath at 6.30 am I was in at 6.45 am. So no breakfast beforfe leaving for the airport. I would never stay here again.
We arrived around midnight asking for 2 rooms for our family of 5. They only had 1 room left as it was Singapore's national day the next day. What did they do?
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: For a discounted price we could get the suite, and they did not charge the extra bed either.
reviews.title: Don't bother with this 1 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Indeed the kingsize bed could easily sleep 4 of us. In the end 3 of us slept in it. The youngest ended up on 1 of the 2 couches. The extra bed was put in the living room.
reviews.title: Go Elsewhere
Don't bother
reviews.text: We stayed at the Excelsior part of these 2 hotels. After strolling through Singapore enjoying the festivities we arrived back around 1800. They allowed us to use the pool and shower before we picked up our luggage for the aiport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was in a great location but the rooms were extremely dated and could use some modern decoration. The communal areas were nice though and both the pools were good. The drinks in the piano bar were too expensive but if you got the same drink in the lobby it was cheaper for some reason.
reviews.title: Great location, shabby rooms

reviews.text: I rated this hotel terrible because it's the room that matters most. While they appear to have renovated the check-in area and other common areas, I hated my room.
reviews.title: Poor room maintenance, Nice common areas

reviews.text: Worst was that the AC rattled. It wasn't just loud but it rattled. Also, the toilet leaked and they had to keep a waste basket under it or the bathroom would have had a puddle in it to leak down to the room below. Finally, there were little bugs all over the desktop.
reviews.title: This hotel is the pits
Depends on your needs
reviews.text: I had stayed in Singapore the previous month and never saw those bugs at the other hotel but this hotel had little fly type bugs that hid under things and walked all over my computer.
With the exception of the renovated lobby area, the hotel is shabby.
reviews.title: Very shabby hotel

likes.disliked: — it was grubby and very run down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on 2 night stopover from london to brisbane on 10th march 08. The flight centre assured us this was a 4 star hotel and great value for money! We stayed in an excelsior room and honestly it was very old and tatty like something out of the 60s which we could deal with but the bathroom was dirty, in fact so dirty i didnt want to use it. We complained and it was "cleaned" but still fithy in my opinion.
reviews.title: disapointed for the cost

reviews.text: The reception area is fairly modern and looks reasonable but the rooms are poor in comparision. The reception is very slow and we had to wait along time to check in/ out even though they were not very busy.
reviews.title: Good Location - Poor rooms

likes.disliked: — terrible bathroom and cramped old fashioned room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one positive thing is the location - very central and we loved singapore but would recommend staying somewhere else!!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on the Singapore stop over program and were disappointed with the room - but as we were only there for one night and the location is good we just put up with it.
reviews.title: Central and Good

reviews.text: We were put in a corner triple room - which is a double with another bed plonked in the room - thus making it very cramped - although the views from the window was fantastic. The bathroom was the worst feature, very old and grubby with mould on the ceiling tiles and so, so small it was impossible to shut the door without first sitting on the toilet - I have literally had a bigger shower area than the total size of this bathroom - we should have complained but as we were only there one night, had alreay waited an hour for a room, and just wanted to get out and about , we accepted it. The room furnishings are old and worn and everything looks drab and it is like staying at an old 60's/70's hotel - not at all what you expect after seeing the lovely reception area. I am not sure how they can even refurbish this room as without knocking into next door you would never be able to get a decent size bathroom.
reviews.title: Good enough for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi everyone!
reviews.title: We'll definitely return here again!

reviews.text: It was a promise kept and a birthday gift also to my girlfriend-- Ners--why we went to the Lion City in the first place. We really had the most difficult time trying to book for a hotel as most of the hotels in Singapore were fully booked (they said there was an international meeting of sorts going on that time). Anyway, when all hope was lost, our travel agent called me up to say she was able to booked us at the Peninsula Excelsior.
reviews.title: OK for stopover

likes.liked: — Breakfast was really good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So there we stayed for five days (October 20-24, 2007) and simply just had the most wonderful time--both in the hotel and in Singapore too! Checking in, we were upgraded, free of charge, by this petite Indian lady receptionist (Sharon, I think was her name) to a room at the 16th floor Excelsior tower. The room we stayed at offers an excellent view of the city, and was pleasantly made-up by the lady in charge of the 16th floor during our whole stay. To add, for a country with not much water resource--the water in the T & B was strong (though the bath tub could really use a fix--draining the water takes so much time). Well, yes, by the way, I hope they reconsider the prices of the stuff they offer at the mini-bar. It's really quite expensive as mentioned by another traveller.
reviews.title: Peninsula average.. Singapore great!

likes.liked: — The tour desk guy called (Dan) in the lobby

reviews.text: Anyway, I can't help it but just mention it here--what really almost put down our spirits in our trip to Singapore? The airline we used! I hate that airline so much! It's Jetstar Asia! Goodness, the interior was dirty, the stewardess impolite! Grrr... Their stewardess ruin the name of the profession! Instead of smiling, their faces seem to hate their work! Grr.
reviews.title: The Orchid Room was Better

reviews.text: Anyway, don't want to end this review with a sad note, so to Peninsula Excelsior, which is just so near to everything you want to visit in Singapore, thanks for the accomodation and hope to be back in your hotel! (Ooops, we love you breakfast too, I almost forgot to mention!)
reviews.title: Only if you have no other choice

likes.disliked: — Too expensive for a 2-3 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually stayed here twice this summer, at the beginning and at the end of our trip. (I booked again for the end of the trip after loving it at the beginning!)
reviews.title: Great Views & Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first experience at the hotel was in the Excelsior tower. The room had been completely redone - everything looked new and clean. The bed was comfortable, and the views over the city were impressive! We really enjoyed reading the morning paper on the window bench seat overlooking the city to the Merlion.
reviews.title: Great location and fantastic views
There was no wireless in a 4 star hotel??
reviews.text: Our second experience at the hotel was in the Peninsula tower. The room here had not been updated (yet?) and showed it's age (watermarks and slightly dingy walls and the like - mainly appearance stuff), but the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and the views over the city were even better than we had experienced before!
The hotel is in a great location, very walkable and central. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Excellent stopover

reviews.text: My husband was booked to stay here for a 5 day training course, directly across the road.
reviews.title: A great start to a good trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at this hotel late at night after a twelve hour flight. On arrival at check in we were told there was no room ready for us and we would have to wait over an hour for a twin room, despite the fact we had booked a double room through our travel agent 6 weeks prior to our arrival. When we complained to reception, they offered us a double smoking room until a smoke free room was available next day. When we moved to the smoke free room next day, we discovered it unbelievably noisy due to an air condition unit outside the room. When we told reception they told us there was nothing they could do as we had already changed rooms once. Basically a take it or leave it attitude. We have stayed in Singapore many times in the past, but it seems to be getting a very expensive place for a stopover.
reviews.title: Only Average

reviews.text: R&S
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: New Zealand
reviews.title: Well located, solid value, very personable staff

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my 1 day stopover flying Singapore Airlines.
reviews.title: Very convenient location near MRT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is really excellent. Near by the St.Andrew Cathedral and less then 800 m to the Bay and Merlion. Subway City Hall station within 300 m from the hotel. The area is also full of shopping and dining precincts.
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here in October 2007 - we're Aussies. We stayed on Excelsior floor 14 which was renovated, non-smoking, clean and air-conditioning working. The breakfast was satisfactory. We arrived at 11pm and the staff were helpful which was a surprise after the reviews I had read. We asked housekeeping for a power converter for an electrical appliance we'd brought with us and it was delivered within 10 minutes. We really only slept in the hotel and didn't have time to use the pool or any other facilities but that wasn't the purpose of our stay. The rooms were poorly lit (no reading in bed possible) though clean and comfortable. The only complaint was that the swipe card keys to access the lift and room took 20 swipes to open the room - the magnetic strip was worn out - other people I met in the lift also had the same problem.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Overall, it is a reasonably priced hotel with great location but for such a cheap price it is good value - don't expect the Westin or Raffles,
reviews.title: Very Bad Service

likes.liked: — I did not like Peninsula Hotel,Singapore

reviews.text: The hotel staff service is really bad. Rooms are too small. Their service is really bad. If we ask or order something they takes 1-2 hrs to send it.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Before we went to Singapore, we arranged our tour package with a Travel Agent Colombo, and we got a holiday package for Three people. We Ordered a TRIPLE room & paid also for THREE.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: After we went to the "Peninsula hotel" (4th November 2007) they had given, every thing only for two.(We got two single beds, Two cups for tea/Coffee, two toothbrushes & two water glasses).Then I went down to the reception & told to send an Extra bed. They said O.K.
reviews.title: The most awful place on earth

likes.disliked: — The fact that there was only 1 working lift serving 20 odd floors

reviews.text: Good location, nice rooms and beautiful view from the room to center of singapore. Great value for your money.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Not sure what other hotels are like in Singapore but we found this one to be decent but nothing special. Very confusing as it is over two towers with a connecting lobby on the 5th floor so if you enter on the wrong tower you have to get out of the elevator and cross over the lobby to get into the next set of elevators. Rooms average even though renovated. Staff good at reception. Fantastic view over the city from the top floor bar - well worth the cost of a round of drinks just to hang out and watch the sunset.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, you can walk to Clarke Quay but be prepared to spend a vast amount of money on very average food and service in this tourist trap.
reviews.title: Near MRT Station and decent room

reviews.text: We booked this hotel at www.hoteltravel.com for a very good price. I guess we're just lucky to get a promo that time. It's a little above our budget but we're glad that we decided to stay there instead of Hotel 81 or Fragance hotel.
reviews.title: Value for money (if you're in the Excelsior tower side)

reviews.text: We came in early and was hoping there would be an available room already. They said that the rooms are still be cleaned by the housekeeping. So we decided to have lunch first and left our bags in the Concierge. However, when we got back, our room is not yet ready! After almost an hour, we got our room keys. I was praying that we will get the renovated rooms because I read a lot of reviews saying that the rooms are not in good condition. Upon entering our room at the 11th floor (I just can't remember if it's in the Peninsula or the Excelsior building), I was happy to see that it's not that bad at all. Our room is big and clean as well as the bathroom. There was way enough space for our 2 big luggages. There's a small fridge and a safe, too. The bed is huge and we didn't have problems sleeping on it. Plus, we had a nice view from our room.
reviews.title: Very clean & tidy. Professional & friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was supposed to be a stop-over.... and this was the only hotel we had trusted our travel agent to book on his own without ocnsulting us...... throughout our trips we had stayed in a five star accommodation only..... and our agent assured us that a four star in singapore is like a five star anywhere else in the world.....
reviews.title: Never-ever going back

reviews.text: the only good thing about this hotel is its location..... its in the heart of the city, so most of the city attrcations are a walkable distance.....
reviews.title: Below Average.

reviews.text: thats where the good things of the hotel stops.....
reviews.title: Worst Hotel

reviews.text: carpets are dirty...... rooms so small dat after u put your luggage , there is no place to move....the smoking floors truely smell....... u have to hold your breath to go to the lift.......the pool is so small and it faces the lobby which is a very awkward location too....
reviews.title: Not as good as you think

reviews.text: i will not recommend this hotel to anyone at all.......
reviews.title: Really disappointing
You get what you pay for...
reviews.text: Having read the reviews here I knew what not to expect! It was the last available choice from the Airlines program. The hotel was central, decent and clean. Checked in late evening from a Singapore stopover holiday program and got the last smoking room(did not want it!) in the hotel. It was straight from the 70's and in desprate need of a renovation. Staff was good, just insist on a new room and confirm in writing in advance your requests(as I did not).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fly by Singapore Airlines, take the stopover offer and choose this hotel only at £ 17 person/pernight (£34 single use), no breakfast but got lots of free vouchers (River Boat Tour, Zoo, Hop on Bus, Sentosa Island, BirdPark, Orchide Garden and many more), VERY good in value, welldone to Singapore Tourism Board! Central Location, yes the hotel bit old and the staff bit rude but they put us in the room with a great view and we're only 1 night, spent time spending the free attractions, at hotel just for sleep, so no complains. Go to Lau Pa Sak Food Market, open 24 hours, good food.
reviews.title: Great View !!!

likes.disliked: — Staff needs to be more friendly

reviews.text: We had one night here on stopover after arriving on a late night flight.
reviews.title: If you don't mind mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Admittedly, we got this room coz it was the cheapest we could find, and we pretty much got what we paid for.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.text: Rooms are very basic despite saying that rooms are refurbished. The bed was super hard and pillows were flat as a tack.
reviews.title: Two half's are better than one... Fairly good...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't even try breakfast here, the price is ridiculous and there's nothing worth mentioning. You're better off going across the road to raffles city food court for breakfast.
reviews.title: had a problem on 1st day. but its a good property to be in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was mighty helpful and friendly with helping us with our checkout, and the staff overall was great.
reviews.title: We'll be back

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and both times the experience was disappointing. The first time it was recommended by a travel agent and as it was just a quick overnight stop we weren't all that bothered. Our room was in the Peninsula tower, it was very tired, musty and we were disturbed several times while trying to sleep. The second time we chose to stay there, despite our better judgement because we were meeting up with an elderly relative who already had a booking there. The checkout procedure was incredibly slow, staff were not very helpful or friendly. We arrived on an early flight and were kept waiting around for nearly three hours in the lobby before being allocated a room. The room itself was quite nice, on a high floor in the Excelsior wing and looked like it had been renovated recently (this was in 2004). When I booked in I asked about late checkout and was informed I could probably have the room until 3pm but to confirm this on the day (our flight didn't leave until midnight), however when it was time to leave I was told we couldn't keep the room past 12pm which was quite inconvenient and meant we really couldn't do anything before going to the airport.
reviews.title: Would not recommend this hotel

reviews.text: My other main complaint was the poor quality of the breakfast - I have travelled a lot and this would definitely rate as the WORST hotel breakfast buffet I have ever experienced. The selection of food was very poor, and didn't really change from day to day.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.text: Overall I had the impression that this hotel was a factory for package tourists - they didn't worry about service or impressions because there would always be plenty more arriving. It is a shame because the location of the hotel was great and prices were OK.
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel close to all

likes.disliked: — Water hammer every afternoon and the beer was nearly $10

reviews.text: Well what can I say.... landed in Singapore we were just on a stopover for one night, thank god! Arrived at hotel at 06:45 after a night flight, finally got a room at 10:30 after three hours sitting in the lobby . The lobby is probably the best part of the hotel and if we had know how bad the rooms were we would have probably stayed there,hehe. We constantly had to remind the staff to check if rooms were ready, they seemed obviously to the fact we were sat waiting for the rooms. and avoided all eye contact.
reviews.title: When was it renovated 1981?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were giving our rooms on the 15th floor, the rooms were clean but not spotless very outdated and in need of some serious TLC and renovation. The whole hotel had a damp smell about it, it just didnt feel clean or comfortable. Then to top it off there was work being carried out in the rooms above us drilling and banging continuously and there was a letter in room informing us, this would continue until 18:30 and start again at 09:30 the next day and it did. The staff were average and did not go out of their way to help you,
reviews.title: stop whinging,

likes.liked: — clean, tidy, well maintained, close to shops etc
likes.disliked: — no entertainment which is part of a holiday

reviews.title: Are Asians not welcome especially under tour package !
reviews.text: The minute we check-in on 11th July,2008, with my wife>> The receptionist said "You must pay SGD50.00 for the Bar Counter". "If you extend your stay, wil be SGD240 per night". One hour later after we came down from our room(We need to call for our luggage to be sent to our room while waiting). The same receptionist did not said a thing, went into small room and produce a chart and said "The rate is now SGD320 per night". We argued and she said "Now you are our WALK-IN CUSTOMER". It was unbelievable and just check-in ONE HOUR ago and already residing in the hotel. The receptionist go on and said" You need to ask your agent to fax us again if you want the same rate.' And what anger us was the way the receptionist body langauge/when she turn to the small room and make some facial expressions at her colleagues ! It was like a message "I gonna give them a hard time." Of course we have a most unpleasant conversations with the Manager.

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel
reviews.text: We came back late after attending the funeral ceremony of my mother/

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: mother-in-law. We open the bar counter and alas! it was empty! We call the reception in the early morning and was told it was a deposit for telephone calls. My wife call me as she was sick on the last day of the funeral and alas! the hotel room telephone was unable to call out to local calls. My husband return wanting to make a police report for "Stolen things from the bar counter". I stop him and we check-in to Bayview hotel.
reviews.title: Comfort zone

likes.liked: — Good location & amazing Funan Centre (5 floors of IT) next door
likes.disliked: — Waiting for the lift which was usually full of footballers

reviews.text: We think we are just being Asian to be treated thus with all this body language/words of unprofessionalism. And why take the package customer from Thailand. And we not spend SGD200 ++ for few hours a day to gain or "steal" from the hotel bar counter. And there was nothing in the bar counter nor telephone service for local calls. Not to mentioned the internet service of SGD1.00 per minute. We just log/in out and get the emails and that cost us SGD10.00. We were worry that we call in the early morning hours to confirm it was SGD10.00 and we do not want any more law/rules biinding us by some unwelcome reception from this hotel. My husband said he will return to be the VIP and walk-in and see how it goes at all cost! Or is it Asian customers will always be treated as sub-standard class of customers.
reviews.title: Location is a Plus
Terrible Experience
reviews.text: We can't understand the previous comments made about this hotel !!! When we stayed in June, 2008, on our way home from Europe we found the hotel (including the room, room service, staff and booking procedures) to be of an excellent standard.

description: The hotel is located in the heart of the city within easy reach to exciting landmarks in Singapore including the Singapore Night Race circuit which is just 2 minutes walk away as it is one of the trackside hotels.Just 5 minutes walk to City Hall MRT Interchange where the North-South, East-West MRT lines meet and also to the popular night spot at Clarke Quay. Only 5 minutes drive to the Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands Casino and Convention Centre, Chinatown and Orchard Road tourist shopping belt. 10 minutes drive to Resorts World Sentosa Casino and Universal Studios theme park. 20 minutes drive to Changi International Airport.The two towers of Peninsula.Excelsior Hotel offer 600 guests rooms and suites with simple luxury as well as function rooms for seminars and wedding banquets. The hotel also offers a business center and a tour desk to assist with travel arrangements.Peninsula.Excelsior Hotel Singapore is an excellent choice for business and holiday travelers.
